I'd highly recommend "Valkyrie" for you. It's a gripping drama based on a real-life plot to assassinate Adolf Hitler during World War II, starring Tom Cruise and Kenneth Branagh. If you're interested in historical thrillers with a touch of warmth, this movie could be right up your alley!

Another film that might catch your interest is "Schindler's List". It's a powerful story about Oskar Schindler, an industrialist who saved over a thousand Jews during the Holocaust. Liam Neeson delivers a stunning performance in this Oscar-winning classic.

This animated masterpiece set in medieval Japan offers an intriguing blend of war, mythology, and deep environmental themes. Starring Claire Danes, Jada Pinkett Smith, and Gillian Anderson, it's a visually stunning film that will keep you engaged from start to finish.

If you're looking for something more contemporary, "Fury" (2014) starring Brad Pitt is another war drama that delivers an intense and gritty portrayal of World War II tank combat. It might just hit the spot if you're into high-stakes military action! Enjoy your movie time!

If you enjoy a more intense and emotional drama, "Tears of the Sun" might also be up your alley. Bruce Willis leads a team on a mission to rescue a doctor while saving 70 refugees in the Nigerian jungle. Both movies are gripping, featuring strong plots and powerful performances from their leading actors. Enjoy the watch!

If you're interested in something a bit more unusual, there's "The Trouble with Harry," a dark comedy from 1955 starring John Forsythe and Alfred Hitchcock. This film tells the story of a dead body that keeps turning up in unexpected places, causing chaos in a small town. It's a unique take on the mystery genre.
